intro: Mariscus nudus, commonly known as the naked mariscus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high salinity and arid conditions. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are typically pale yellow or white, and it produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Mariscus nudus is considered a vulnerable species.
